page.title: 19How Nuneaton has changed (2)
page.content:
There used to be two railway stations- Trent Valley,which is on the main line from London to Scotland and is still used,and Abbey Street,which was on the local line between Leicester and Birmingham and has now been closed.
During the 1939-45 War there was a lot of bomb damage in Church Street, killing many people and destroying homes.The new library was built where these houses once stood.
The Coronation of Queen Elizabeth 11 was watched on a black and white TV and at night there was a large bonfire in the park.
The town has grown much bigger,the streets wider and the centre is now a pedestrian only area.
